item.title: Covid-19: Brazil 'variant of concern' detected in UK
item.description: Six cases of the variant first detected in Brazil have now been found in England and Scotland.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 20 million in UK have had first jab
item.description: The milestone is a "huge national achievement" and "every jab makes a difference", Boris Johnson says.

item.title: Coronation Street star Johnny Briggs dies aged 85
item.description: The actor, who played Mike Baldwin in the soap, died after a long illness, his family said.

item.title: Myanmar coup: Deadliest day of protests as police open fire
item.description: At least 18 people are killed as police try to disperse huge anti-coup rallies in several cities.

item.title: Golden Globe Awards 2021: Stars prepare for virtual ceremony
item.description: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler return to host the year's first major film and TV awards ceremony on Sunday.

item.title: Doctor joins Zoom court hearing while operating on patient
item.description: Medical officials in California say they will investigate surgeon Scott Green.

item.title: Budget: Rishi Sunak promises help as Covid restrictions ease
item.description: But the chancellor says he wants "to be honest" with the public about the shock suffered by the economy.

item.title: CPAC: Trump returns to political stage at conservative conference
item.description: The former US president tells the conservative conference he will not start a new political party.

item.title: BBC condemns online abuse of Six Nations reporter Sonja McLaughlan
item.description: Online abuse sent to reporter Sonja McLaughlan after the live broadcast of Wales' Six Nations win over England is strongly condemned by the BBC.

item.title: Family found camping on 'dangerous' cliff edge in North Yorkshire
item.description: A couple with a child had set up camp on a cliff edge in an area known for landslips.

item.title: Glenn Roeder: Former West Ham and Newcastle manager dies aged 65
item.description: Former Watford, West Ham, Newcastle and Norwich manager Glenn Roeder dies aged 65, says the League Managers Association.

item.title: Covid-19: Police break up crowd of 250 watching fight
item.description: An "organised fight" in a yard in County Tyrone was a clear breach of Covid-19 rules, say police.

item.title: Covid-19: Far-left link to Dublin lockdown protest 'disproved'
item.description: Protestors were from anti-vaccine and far-right groups, says Garda Commissioner Drew Harris.

item.title: Denver family wows neighbourhood with snow art
item.description: The Mosley family spent 10 hours creating this colourful snake sculpture out of snow.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'the beauty of trees'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

item.title: Covid: Beach car parks shut to stop lockdown rule-breakers
item.description: 'Crowds' reported as people also fined for travelling to "take pictures of their dogs together"

item.title: Sam Ryder: TikTok's singing superstar
item.description: Sam Ryder on TikTok, Britney, Justin Bieber and his new solo career.

item.title: Maids in Lebanon: 'My employer treats me like a slave'
item.description: Lucy's dream of working in the Middle East turned into a nightmare of abuse. She's not the only one.

item.title: ‘Pawstep’ Portraits: Photographing Tails of the Pandemic
item.description: "Pawstep Portraits" captures dogs with their owners, who then donate to the NHS or Lanta Animal Welfare.

item.title: Rare Disease Day: The family who lost three children
item.description: Toni and Stewart Mathieson lost all three of their children to the same condition.

item.title: Selby rail crash: Disaster remembered 20 years on
item.description: Twenty years on, the Selby rail crash remains the UK's worst rail disaster of the 21st Century.

item.title: Afghanistan: A year of violence on the road to peace
item.description: On the anniversary of the US-Taliban deal, Afghanistan finds itself in a precarious state.

item.title: The influencer effect: 'Love Island star transformed my business'
item.description: Influencers can have a bad reputation but for some people they have proved to be a business lifeline.

item.title: Has China lifted 100 million people out of poverty?
item.description: President Xi says China has achieved his poverty reduction pledge - but has it?

item.title: LGBT+ History Month: The kiss - a seminal moment, a total accident
item.description: Neither Gus Kenworthy nor his then-boyfriend knew the cameras were rolling when they shared a seminal kiss at Pyeongchang 2018.

item.title: The challenge of being gay and an MI6 spy
item.description: Former intelligence officers describe a precarious existence in which your career could end at any moment.

item.title: How Bitcoin's vast energy use could burst its bubble
item.description: Could the cryptocurrency's huge electricity consumption also sink it?

item.title: Liverpool end run of four successive league defeats by beating Sheffield Utd
item.description: Liverpool end a run of four successive Premier League defeats with victory over Sheffield United at Bramall Lane.

item.title: '100% nailed-on penalty' - Solskjaer fears referees are being swayed by 'outside influences'
item.description: Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says his side should have had a "100% nailed-on" penalty in the goalless draw with Chelsea and blames "outside influences" for it not being given.

item.title: Higgins says he had 'best week' of career after thrashing O'Sullivan to win Players Championship
item.description: John Higgins says he has had the "best week" of his career after beating Ronnie O'Sullivan 10-3 in the the Players Championship final.

item.title: St Johnstone beat Livingston to lift Scottish League Cup for first time
item.description: St Johnstone lift the Scottish League Cup for the first time as Shaun Rooney's first-half header is enough to edge out Livingston.

item.title: Why LGBT+ History Month matters to athletes
item.description: Swimmer Michael Gunning, racing driver Charlie Martin and rugby union player Florence Williams speak about why LGBT+ History Month matters.

item.title: Formula E: British driver Alex Lynn 'well' after shocking crash at Diriyah E-prix
item.description: Watch British driver Alex Lynn's shocking crash during round two of the Formula E season in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: England will not complain about refereeing to World Rugby
item.description: England will not make an official complaint to World Rugby over the refereeing in Saturday's 40-24 defeat against Wales.

item.title: Covid variants: What are they and will vaccines work?
item.description: More cases are being found in the UK, including a variant first seen in Brazil.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The prime minister has announced a plan for how the lockdown will be lifted in England.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Two approved Covid vaccines are being rolled out across the UK. So when might you get one?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 20 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Have lockdowns affected my child's physical and mental health?
item.description: Should parents of under-fives worry about Covid restrictions harming their child's development?

item.title: Fly-tipping: Licensing system failing to stop dumping, Panorama finds
item.description: A BBC Panorama investigation finds licensed firms involved in the dumping of rubbish.

item.title: Which festivals will go ahead in 2021?
item.description: Those working in festivals tell Newsbeat they are "cautiously optimistic" after Reading and Leeds announcement.

item.title: Child heart transplants: 'I'm ecstatic I got such an amazing gift'
item.description: Freya Heddington, 14, had a new type of transplant where "non-beating donor hearts" are revived.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Getting married is the most important thing'
item.description: What will the lifting restrictions on weddings mean to couples and those in the industry?

item.title: Covid: MP told to 'dress properly' for House of Commons debate
item.description: Jonathan Gullis was barred from speaking in the House of Commons until he had put on a jacket.
